Medical Issues - Complication developed in the hospital

Jargon Term: You breathing improved and at the time of discharge, you were breathing comfortably on 3 L of oxygen by nasal cannula

You also had significant problems with [**Name2 (NI) 98652**] in the hospital, requiring several medications to have a bowel movement. At the rehab center you can stop these medications as long as you are not constipated.

Please make the following changes to your medication: 1. start Sucralfate 1 gm by mouth 4 times daily 2. protonix 40 mg by mouth twice daily 3. prednisone taper (30, 20, 10 mg) by mouth for 3 days 4. azithromycin 250 mg by mouth for 2 days

You should call your doctor immediately or return to the hospital if you should develop any fever, chills, abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, chest pain, shortness of breath, or any other symptoms that concern you.
